retrieved_context:
name: spider web
type: Structure
description: A spider"s web is a structure made by spiders to catch prey. It consists of sticky spiral lines and non-sticky radial lines. name: Spider"s Web
type: Structure
description: A spider"s web is a structure made of silk, used for catching prey and as a habitat. name: Spider Web
type: Web Structure
description: A structure made by spiders using silk to catch prey. relation: Spiders --[Produce]-> Silk--description:Spiders produce silk, a versatile and strong material.-- name: Spiders
type: Arachnids
description: Spiders are fascinating creatures known for their ability to build intricate webs and produce different types of silk. They use their webs as hunting grounds and homes, demonstrating remarkable skill and precision in construction. relation: Spiders --[Use]-> Web--description:Spiders use their webs to detect vibrations, test tension, and make adjustments during the web-building process.-- relation: Spiders --[Build]-> Webs--description:Spiders build webs to catch prey and create their living spaces.-- name: Prey
type: Organism
description: Animals that are caught in the spider"s web, serving as a food source. name: Web
type: Structure
description: A complex structure built by spiders to catch prey and serve as a home. relation: Spiders --[Trap]-> Prey--description:Spiders trap prey using their webs and immobilize it with a bite before wrapping it in silk for later consumption.-- relation: Spiders --[Create]-> Egg Sacs--description:Spiders create egg sacs using their silk.-- name: Egg Sacs
type: Structure
description: Structures made of silk used by spiders to protect their eggs. name: Mating Rituals
type: Behavior
description: Rituals performed by spiders during mating, which may involve the use of silk. name: Webs
type: Structure
description: Intricate and efficient structures used by spiders as hunting grounds and homes. Webs are built using radial lines, spiral lines, and a trap line. relation: Spiders --[Use In]-> Mating Rituals--description:Spiders use their silk in various mating rituals.-- name: Silk
type: Material
description: A remarkable material that is incredibly strong and elastic, used by spiders for various purposes such as building webs, creating egg sacs, or for use in mating rituals. name: spider
type: Arachnid
description: Spiders are fascinating creatures known for their ability to build intricate webs. name: Spider
type: Arachnid
description: A small to large eight-legged invertebrate that can produce silk and is known for building webs. name: Webs
type: Structure
description: Intricate and efficient structures used by spiders as hunting grounds and homes. Webs are built using radial lines, spiral lines, and a trap line. name: Web
type: Structure
description: A complex structure built by spiders to catch prey and serve as a home.

correct_answer: Webs serve as homes and hunting grounds for spiders.

description: A structure made by spiders using silk to catch prey. relation: Spiders --[Produce]-> Silk--description:Spiders produce silk, a versatile and strong material.-- name: Spiders
type: Arachnids
description: Spiders are fascinating creatures known for their ability to build intricate webs and produce different types of silk. They use their webs as hunting grounds and homes, demonstrating remarkable skill and precision in construction. relation: Spiders --[Use]-> Web--description:Spiders use their webs to detect vibrations, test tension, and make adjustments during the web-building process.-- relation: Spiders --[Build]-> Webs--description:Spiders build webs to catch prey and create their living spaces.-- name: Prey
type: Organism
description: Animals that are caught in the spider"s web, serving as a food source. name: Web
type: Structure
description: A complex structure built by spiders to catch prey and serve as a home. relation: Spiders --[Trap]-> Prey--description:Spiders trap prey using their webs and immobilize it with a bite before wrapping it in silk for later consumption.-- relation: Spiders --[Create]-> Egg Sacs--description:Spiders create egg sacs using their silk.-- name: Egg Sacs
type: Structure
description: Structures made of silk used by spiders to protect their eggs. name: Mating Rituals
type: Behavior
description: Rituals performed by spiders during mating, which may involve the use of silk. name: Webs

description: Intricate and efficient structures used by spiders as hunting grounds and homes. Webs are built using radial lines, spiral lines, and a trap line. relation: Spiders --[Use In]-> Mating Rituals--description:Spiders use their silk in various mating rituals.-- name: Silk
type: Material
description: A remarkable material that is incredibly strong and elastic, used by spiders for various purposes such as building webs, creating egg sacs, or for use in mating rituals. name: Webs

description: Intricate and efficient structures used by spiders as hunting grounds and homes. Webs are built using radial lines, spiral lines, and a trap line. name: Web
